english: a long time; quite a while

etymology.description: 好 (very) + 久 (long time) = quite a long time.
etymology.interpretation: Combines an intensifier with a duration noun to mean “a long/quite a while.” Often used in greetings (好久不见) and adverbially before verbs.

examples.chinese: 我们好久没联系了(我們好久沒聯繫了)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen hǎo jiǔ méi liánxì le.
examples.english: We haven’t been in touch for a long time.

examples.chinese: 我等了好久(我等了好久)，他才来(他才來)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ děng le hǎo jiǔ, tā cái lái.
examples.english: I waited for a long time before he finally came.
